Important Articles.headline: President Donald Trump's return to protectionist economic policies has placed significant pressure on leading tech companies, which have been the primary catalysts behind the S&P 500's (SNPINDEX: ^GSPC) remarkable performance since October 2022.  While short-term market volatility can be unsettling, it creates valuable opportunities to acquire tomorrow's market leaders at substantial discounts relative to their long-term potential.  Artificial intelligence (AI) stocks exemplify this opportunity.
Important Articles.title: 2 AI Stocks I Can't Stop Buying

Important Articles.headline: Archer Aviation (ACHR) has secured $430 million in funding and is partnering with Anduril to build a defense aircraft. Archer Aviation CEO Adam Goldstein joins Catalysts with Seana Smith and Madison Mills to discuss the company's new defense unit. "Today, we announced the Archer Defense business unit, which is a business unit that will leverage all the technologies that we have been working on on the commercial side," Goldstein says, explaining, "A good way to think about this is expanding kind of what we already do." The CEO adds details on the eVTOL developer's (electric vertical take-off and landing) exclusive partnership with Anduril: "Anduril being the premier defense tech company in the world, it's an amazing partner for Archer. But the investment community was very positive on this as well, and we raised an additional $430 million of capital to go alongside it." Watch the video above to learn more about Goldstein's expectations of the incoming Trump administration, how Archer plans to spend the funding, and more. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Catalysts here. This post was written by Naomi Buchanan.
Important Articles.title: Archer Aviation CEO discusses new defense unit, Anduril partnership

Important Articles.headline: Archer Aviation (NYSE: ACHR) has garnered a loyal following of investors who are optimistic about the company's innovative electric vertical takeoff and landing (eVTOL) aircraft.  Contracts with the U.S. government and recent new funding are helping to drive the stock price, which is up 82% over the past 12 months.  The company has yet to generate any revenue, and the recent share price gains mean investors are paying a premium for a company without sales.
Important Articles.title: Archer Aviation: Buy, Sell, or Hold?

Important Articles.headline: We recently published a list of Jim Cramer’s Latest Lightning Round: 7 Stocks in Focus. In this article, we are going to take a look at where Archer Aviation Inc. (NYSE:ACHR) stands against other stocks that Jim Cramer discusses in latest lightning round. On Thursday, Jim Cramer, the host of Mad Money, pointed out that […]
Important Articles.title: Jim Cramer’s Stark Warning on Archer Aviation (ACHR): ‘An Invitation to Your Funeral’

Important Articles.headline: EVTOL (electric vertical take-off and landing aircraft) developer Archer Aviation (ACHR) shares are lifting off on Friday after announcing a deal with Abu Dhabi Aviation. Julie Hyman and Josh Lipton also dive into Archer Aviation's disappointing earnings figures. Catch Yahoo Finance's full interview with Archer Aviation CEO Adam Goldstein from December 2024, where he discusses the company's strategic partnership with Anduril Industries. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination here. This post was written by Luke Carberry Mogan.
Important Articles.title: Archer Aviation stock takes off on new Abu Dhabi air taxi deal

Important Articles.headline: SANTA CLARA, Calif., December 12, 2024--Today, Anduril and Archer (NYSE: ACHR) announced an exclusive partnership to jointly develop a hybrid VTOL aircraft for critical defense applications targeting a potential program of record from the DOD.
Important Articles.title: Archer Announces Strategic Partnership With Anduril to Develop Hybrid VTOL Military Aircraft; Raises An Additional $430M
